Reviews.Title: “Great place, even in the rain”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidTraveller201
Reviews.Content: Came for a coup,e of nights with our children. Suite was good for us to share, breakfast was excellent and resuataurant recommendations spot on. Bring your walking shoes and get a pass for the river bus early for maximum value.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Ticino4
Reviews.Content: We decided at a short term to travel to Venice, The Tripadvisor reviews were that positive for this little hotel that without hope i mailed the request. And we were lucky one room free for two nights. Finding The hotel was not a problem, but print the confermation the foto from the front door and the plan will help you. We arrived in the morning and we could leave our luggage at the entrance till checking in at two o`clock. The staff (all of them !!) are very friendly and helpful. We had a room on the first floor: The Suite Turchese, What a beautiful room with a lot of space a bedroom you can just dream of. We slept very good and in the morning the smell of fresh baked bread guided us to the breakfast. This was a great breakfast we counted 10 different kinds of bread, pastries and cakes. Otherwise you can find also fresh fruit, yogurt and cereals. This was our third stay in Venice but for the next time the hotel will be Oltre il Giardino.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence on offer -- but don't expect `facilities'”
Reviews.Author: PHNorthLondon
Reviews.Content: In common probably with most others, we learned of this place via Tripadvisor. We looked forward to our visit, with just a slight background fear that something might occur to make us the first to be forced to award it fewer than 4 stars. What a responsibility that would be! But no -- we had a great stay for all the reasons that have been amply explained already on here. Whether 4 or 5 stars depends really on criteria -- not of standards of care, cleanliness, decor, setting or charm (all as fine as most others report; so too breakfast) but whether you are expecting facilities additional to your lodging. Essentially there aren't any: there is the lounge and garden and that's that. This would lead me, for all my enthusiasm, not to join a previous reviewer in calling it "one of the great hotels of the world." It doesn't purport to be -- it's a top-notch bed-and-breakfast establishment. On that basis one can warmly recommend and would gladly return if opportunity arose. The ground floor `green suite' was terrific, but just one detail: we did find the mattress hard.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a find!”
Reviews.Author: Con022
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oltre il Giardino in July of 2011. My husband, 2 boys and my mother. Everyone was happy. What we enjoyed the most was that we started the day with a delightful breakfast with fresh cheese, and prosciutto, coffee or coco, different kinds of juice ,and pastries. The food was fresh and we always looked foward to the next morning. It was so nice to sit with my family in the garden and talk. The staff was so pleasant. We would definitely go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: Becky2010
Reviews.Content: I hesitated to write this review because I didn't think that I could do this hotel justice, and also, like others, because I wish that it would remain a secret of sorts. There's not much to be said that hasn't been written. It's a respite in a crazy, wonderful city. The people who work here are all, each and every one, lovely and helpful. It somehow manages to feel homey while not feeling bed and breakfast-y. The details from the front door down to the pillow on your bed are all thoughtful and beautiful. I would recommend anyone stay here, and I dream about being able to come back. I will add some of the pictures I took. We were on the top floor in a suite or junior suite? Whatever it was was perfect. We traveled in August, and had a glorious time.

Reviews.Title: “Haven/Heaven”
Reviews.Author: RamblersOhio
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else who has posted lately, I'm crazy about this place. Even though it worked out to about $200 a day (winter rates) it was worth it. And worth it not just for the secluded location, good food, etc. but for the suggestions of the staff about places to eat. It's not always so easy to find really good food in Venice (especially along the main tourist routes), but they suggested a place (out of the way) that was exactly what we wanted (in our case, great fish). I've stayed in three other places in Venice and each had its charms, but this was the best. I kind of hate to say this since I don't want it to be full when I want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, wow, wow!”
Reviews.Author: Pokkstar
Reviews.Content: This gem of a hotel has the trifecta of fabulous location, truly superb service and great value. Not to mention the beautiful, understated decor and the thoughtful touches everywhere. I'm not the kind of traveller who depends much on hotel staff for recommendations, or considers going back to a place just to go back to the hotel, but Oltre Il Giardino is just that good! Everyone at reception was genuinely so sweet and helpful that it really felt like we were coming home at the end of every day. And the place does feel like home - a beautifully decorated and clean one :-) Thank you to everyone who made our stay so wonderful. We look forward to being back in Venice... And we won't even think of staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful and private”
Reviews.Author: Andrea R
Reviews.Content: Wonderful clean spacious room with view to garden. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Great location. Best breakfast of anywhere we stayed during our 7 week holiday. Would definitely stay here next time we visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A "Hidden" treasure”
Reviews.Author: NHRoamer
Reviews.Content: Tucked away midst all the hubbub of Venice is this terrific "hotel." It's really a comfortable home-away-from-home with an extraordinarily helpful and friendly staff, beautiful garden, comfortable rooms. Excellent breakfasts - we woke to the delightful smell of baking every morning. Location is convenient to just about everywhere, especially if you're a walker/roamer, and there are lots of good restaurants and shopping within reach. A truly enjoyable spot to fully enjoy Venice and yet get away from it when you need to.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: JoanneDaveOscarIsis
Reviews.Content: We rested at Oltre for three nights at the beginning of October with our two children aged 5 and 1. We were made so welcome, we felt like guests in the home of a friend. The staff Ilaria, Rita and Emmanuelo were helpful and kind and gave us lots of advice. They were lovely with our children and there were even slippers for the children in the room! Our room was large, light and beautifully furnished. The location is ideal, and the garden is such a treat; especially as the weather was lovely and we could have long breakfasts there. The breakfast selection is extensive and delicious. A private taxi to the water entrance of the hotel is a fabulous way to arrive, especially with the convenience it affords with two small children and luggage. The craftsmanship at the Legatoria Polliero shop on the Campo dei Frari 1 minute away has to be seen - please buy something in this wonderful shop! It will be an ideal souvenir of Venice. Oltre il Giardino is a hidden gem in a city of treasures, we will return and we would never want to stay anywhere else when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure!”
Reviews.Author: BTownBackpackers
Reviews.Content: We were not disappointed in our recent September stay at this nice hotel. We had an annex room with two windows opening onto the little canal and one onto the garden. The gondolas would pass by and the church bells ring. Wonderful! A comfortable bed with robes and slippers were provided. It was a nice quiet treat away from the busiest areas of Venice. Breakfast in the garden was a pleasure every morning and, one evening, we had our own personal picnic at one of the tables. One of our hosts added the sweet touch of bringing out little candles to add the finishing touch. As many have stated, the friendly and welcoming staff truly made it a very special stay. Grazie mille to Ilaria and the whole staff!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful hotel in San Polo to which we will return”
Reviews.Author: HautdeCagnes
Reviews.Content: Small, quiet and well managed hotel in San Polo. We had a suite on the first floor overlooking the garden. Good sized room with separate sitting area; very comfortable large bed; great bathroom with bath and shower and Bulgari products. My only very tiny niggle was there were no drawers in the room, just some high shelves (lots of hanging space). Breakfast was served in the garden - choice of tea/coffee with a good buffet selection of cereals, breads, fresh fruit, pastries, juice etc. (I believe there was also eggs/ham which we did not take). The staff were multi lingual, helpful and very happy to book restaurants. After a very large lunch one day we decided to get a takeaway pizza in the evening which we enjoyed sitting in the garden with a bottle of wine. The manager was happy to get us glasses, plates, napkins etc. We chose the hotel based on a review in the Daily Telegraph and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in quiet but convenient part of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Expat_Kiwi_01
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and were very happy with the choice. The location was easily reached from the train station via the public ferry to the stop at San Tomo, and a short walk. The entrance is through a lovely garden. We had a room in the annex and so were originally a little alarmed to be taken out the back door down the alley way into another entrance, but actually found it very convenient as we just came and went through the alley instead of having to go through the hotel. The breakfast is excellent, and the service very good. Our room looked out onto both the canal and the garden (small windows but able to be opened) and was very modern and comfortable. The bathroom was very clean, with Bulgari toiletries, robes and slippers. The bed was very comfortable, pillows a little less so but a choice of two different kinds (hard and soft). It was very quiet except for the noise of the people above walking around. The location, for us, was fantastic. We do not like to be in the middle of the 'tourist action' but were about 1 km away from San Marco - a very easy walk or ferry trip. One added bonus was the proximity to the Frari church - possibly something we wouldn't have sought out but which was the most amazing church we saw in Venice (and easily surpassed the Florence Duomo in our view). Some lovely local shops not selling tourist junk and some good local restaurants nearby. We would recommend this hotel to other travellers who like modern (not gilt/brocade/chintz) decor, efficient and friendly service, away from the madding crowds.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful, friendly hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Katenodo
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Oltre Il Giardino immensely. The staff were incredibly helpful, the garden was a tranquil haven, our room was delightful and breakfast was delicious. What more could anyone ask?

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: GayTravelGuyDC
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of my favorite places ever. It was just a fantastic stay for me. It is in an amazing location, right in the center of things but very quiet and private. The entrance is at the deadend of a little street, next to a canal. This means water taxis can pull right up to the entrance, but no one ever will walk by it. Inside is a lovely little garden, and the elegant house that is this small hotel. The decor is simple but rich, historic but modern, just perfect. The staff were VERY nice and helpful. The breakfast each morning delicious. The room was spacious and comfortable. I loved being able to close my window shutters each night for extra darkness. Not if, but WHEN I go back to Venice, I will only stay here.

Reviews.Title: “wow!”
Reviews.Author: SarahWZ
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! This may be the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in (and I stay in a lot of hotels). Venice is a city with very little greenery, but this hotel has the loveliest little garden where you can eat breakfast or just sit and rest. The hotel is immaculately clean. The breakfasts are the best breakfasts I've ever had. The problem is avoiding overeating! The coffee was unbelievable, even for Italy. The art work decorating the walls and rooms is gorgeous. The staff was very friendly, very helpful. I stayed in a suite with my 11 year old son. Some possible downsides: if you are a very strict vegetarian, you may not appreciate the cow hide that serves as a rug. If you are very modest, or are traveling with adolescents, one of the paintings in my room may be a bit too risque. I did worry a bit that my kid might damage the valuable furniture and art, although most of the people there were traveling with children (weekend visit).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff & attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: edwardjbewick
Reviews.Content: Lovely bed and breakfast... nothing is too much effort for the staff here, they had some good recommendations for restaurants, which they were happy to book for us.. when we took the complimentary bottle of prosecco they gave us to celebrate our honeymoon (a lovely touch), they were on hand bringing us complimentary nibbles. The rooms themselves are tastefully decorated (each one has a colour theme, ours was 'aubergine') with some interesting art hanging on the walls. Extremely comfortable & high quality as you would expect. Breakfast was nice, & additional ham and cheese can be ordered at no additional cost! Great place, lovely staff & excellent attention to detail made for a really enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “A little less than wonderful”
Reviews.Author: LondonZ33
Reviews.Content: We have been to Venice many times and know it well. Oltre il Giardino is wonderfully situated near the Frari, yet secluded and peaceful. The garden itself is very fine and a good place to sit when sightseeing has taken its toll. It attracts birds that one no longer sees in London, sparrows for example, and has an established mulberry tree, highly unusual in any Italian city, let alone Venice. Our room was in itself good and spacious, tastefully and not routinely decorated. The mosquito netting that covered each of the four windows was much appreciated -- we never discovered whether it was needed, but were glad not to have to find out the hard way. The problems we had, however, were rather too numerous to give this place unqualified praise. After 24 hours we discovered that the minibar-fridge was actually keeping things warm. The next day we found the air conditioning was simply recycling uncooled air, and for May it was hot, into the 90s Fahrenheit. The door into the bathroom creaked noisily at night. The internet connection, admittedly free, was painfully slow. Towards the end of our week's stay the toilet flush ceased to function. None of this was disastrous, and every small irritation was promptly dealt with by the staff of the hotel, all of whom were pleasant and attentive. But for euros 250 per night we should not have been placed in the position of having to complain about something nearly every day. We may just have been unlucky.

Reviews.Title: “A total charmer”
Reviews.Author: notjacobscreek
Reviews.Content: What a delight. Fresh, airy, chintz-free - this place is a breath of fresh air amongst Venice's overpriced brocade-filled tourist hotels. Tiny, welcoming, and simply but stylishly furnished. Excellent breakfast. Super-clean. Sweet little garden. And located in a great neighbourhood, just around the corner from the stunning Friari cathederal on San Polo. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goonergirl62
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Oltre Il Giardino last week and it was the most fabulous experience. From when we arrived and Emmanuel said 'welcome home' to when we left, we could not fault it. Our room was in the annexe and we had a sitting room as well which was great. Beautifully furnished although if I am honest I think there are a few bits of wall where the paint needs touching up, but that is real nit-picking. Lovely big comfy bed, windows you could open, proper hair-dryer, desk you could sit at, and more than enough room to swing a cat. The breakfast was served in the downstairs reception room or in the lovely garden, depending on the weather and there was anything you could want. Made rather a pig of myself with the pastries. In a great location and really easy to get anywhere you want to but also quiet and peaceful at night. A fantastic experience and no hesitation at all in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: rspano
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous place to stay in Venice. Great location, lovely setting, awesome/superb service and at a great price. The breakfast is first class and Ilaria and Manuel know all the good restaurants. I would recommend this little charm to anyone and definitely plan on staying there each time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place. Quiet, central, pretty and lovely people”
Reviews.Author: Gourmet_Vegetarian
Reviews.Content: I really liked staying in San Polo rather than San Marco. You sacrifice very little in convenience (Venice is tiny, after all) but you gain a lot in terms of peace and even charm. Oltre Il Gardino is a charming little hotel situated across a little bridge from I' Frari, not far from Rialto. It has a pretty little garden where guests eat breakfast during warmer months (late March - September or October). The breakfasts are perfectly nice (not always the case, even in this price bracket) without being amazing. The rooms are smallish but generally well designed and clean. The Bulgari products in the bathroom were appreciated. The feel of the place is terrific, very relaxed and breezy. Lots of birds (thanks to the garden). It must be one of the most peaceful spots in Venice. My only criticism is that, while the place is clean, the sheets and dressing gowns need to be replaced. The blanket on our bed was covered in what seemed to be stains from cigarette burns. The dressing gowns seemed to be about 10 years old. By contrast, the staff were all so friendly and helpful - absolutely world class.

Reviews.Title: “perfect oasis in Venetian bustle”
Reviews.Author: torontoguys_11
Reviews.Content: We spend nine nights in this quiet house - 4 junior suites, 2 rooms, and 2 rooms or suites in next door annex - wonderfully attended to by Lorenzo and his superb, small staff. You feel like you are staying with a rich friend of a friend in their private house in Venice. Our impeccably clean, top floor junior suite had a lovely sitting room, great bed and pillows, well laid-out bathroom and four big windows over-lookiing the charming wall-enclosed garden and small canal beyond. We sleep with our windows open and were only woken in the morning by the birds in the bamboo in the garden. Breakfasts were great, wonderful selection of fresh fruit, rolls, cereals, hard-boiled eggs, fresh orange juice and any kind of coffee you want. Nothing seems to be too much trouble for Lorenzo, Illaria or Emmanuelle - if you need advice on anything, restaurants, day-trips, water taxis, just ask. With its great location, this place is as close to perfect as one could hope for and was wonderful value for all you get.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: KatrinaTravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great because it is very small which allows the owner and staff to get to know you and provide you whith what you need. The rooms are clean and very well decorated, as well as attended to frequently. Service is great- fast and satisfying. The hotel serves breakfast in the morning, as well as tea and cookies in the late afternoon. The house is well maintained, with a great garden in the front, a place to have breakfast if the weather is ideal and have tea in the afternoon if you wish. The hotel is in a great area, you can easily access all other parts of Venice by walking. Overall, I was extremely pleased with the hotel and highly recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “top notch B&B in San Polo”
Reviews.Author: wobbs1
Reviews.Content: Oltre Il Giardino is a perfect little hideaway in a residential neighborhood near the Frari church. It's an easy walk from the train or Piazzale Roma, but not so close to San Marco. The hotel is quiet and peaceful, and gardens such as this hotel possesses are rare in Venice. However, the best thing about Oltre Is Giardino is the staff. The young folks that run the hotel speak excellent English and very much want to help you enjoy your stay in Venice. What more can you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel perfection in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: asravello
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed with friends at Oltre Il Giardino for five nights in November and were in bliss. It seemed like a modern version of where a woman in a Henry James novel might have stayed - privacy, superb service, immaculate surroundings, and the perfect place to come home to after a day of wandering and getting happily lost in Venice. We loved the clean, simple and elegant decor. Breakfasts were excellent, as was the service throughout our stay from all members of staff. We dream of returning to Venice and Oltre Il Giardino.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hideaway from Venice's tourist hordes”
Reviews.Author: Kate024
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect antidote to Venice's tacky touristy areas. The room was decorated very stylishly and was a perfect size. The location is next to the Frari, one of the most dramatic Cathedrals I have ever visited. The breakfast was served in a cosy living room area and was delicious, with lovely pastries, muesli, breads, coffee and meats and cheese on offer. The gentleman who was there in the evening was very nice and full of information about Venice. The only issue I have is that on our second day there was some flooding, this meant that walking about without waterproof shoes was very difficult (prepare to get lost a lot, its part of the fun!). The hotel didn't give us any warning of this and it would be great if they perhaps provided wellies/waterproof shoes - we saw some people with sort of waterproof shoe type things on that had been provided by their hotels. WIth regards to Venice - avoid the area around the Rialto and St Marks Basilico - yes the Basilico is spectacular from the outside but dealing with the annoying tourist crowds is not worth it. There are some amazing churches to visit (although this sounds obvious, a lot of them are not open for tourists on a Sunday - as none church goers this stupidly didn't occur to us!!!) that you don't have to queue to get into. Also, we bought the Venice Connected card for Â£23 each, as well as some toilet cards and the vapparreto pass. The only one worth getting is the Vapparetto pass, for toilets just dive into a coffee shop and use the toilet stop as an excuse for a coffee/spritz and some snacks. Venice is much nicer at night than during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Loveliest hotel I have stayed in"”
Reviews.Author: MarinaCanberra
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with usasnob who declares a certain reluctance to share. We stayed in this hotel in September 2010. We had booked for 3 nights but ended up staying 4. I had not really wanted to visit Venice and only did so at the urging of my partner, but the from the moment we arrived I fell in love with it. The hotel is quite small and a little away from Piazza San Marco (although it is an easy walk to almost anywhere you want to go), and it felt like a beautiful haven. The main part of Venice is very crowded with tourists, and has a disneyland feel (a bit of a conunundrum as of course we were tourists too!). However, the area around this hotel seemed to be a place people live. You can still walk to anywhere you want to go. I loved everything about the hotel. The garden, the rooms (beautifully furnished but not excessively lavish), the charming staff. There was a genuine attention to detail. I hope to go back, but if I don't, the stay here will remain in my memory as a highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Magical and unique. Easily one of the great hotels of the world.”
Reviews.Author: usasnob
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at here in August, coming from a Chateau&Relais Hotel in Rome and going to a private villa in Tuscany afterwards. In Venice, I usually stay at the Gritti Palace or the Cipriani, but I was travelling with my ex-husband, our 10 and 14 year old children and my grown nephew, and decided to try something different, partially because of the hideous tourist hordes that plague Venice in the summer. I'm a hotel connossieur from way back, extremely demanding, and have stayed in some of the finest places in the world on pretty much every continent. I'm only half-willing to write this review because I actually don't want you to discover this stunning hotel. Easily the loveliest place we stayed on our trip. Exquisite environment that the pictures don't do justice to. Perfect location. Impeccable service. Imagine that you live in Venice, in a gorgeous, beautifully decorated private home, set in a miraculous swath of garden (the only grass we saw in Venice) and are attended by a group of unobtrusive but wildly attentive people who know all the best places to go and see and eat and quietly arrange everything for you. This comes close to our experience but barely scratches the surface of it. We had two of their suites. Beautifully furnished and decorated. One, on the ground floor, opened onto the garden and a tiny private terrace. The other, on the top floor was like a luxurious little rooftop garret from which we could look down onto the garden and the canal beyond. Lovely bathrooms. Entire place exquisitely clean. Bulgari toiletries. An honor bar in the lovely living room with high-end drinks. Breakfast (or drinks) in their garden is worth the trip to Venice alone. You don't think of Venice in summer as a "peaceful" place, but this certainly was. We were directed to lovely restaurants off the beaten path that we weren't previously familiar with. Though you are a 10+ minute walk from the tourist sites (only a few moments walk from the San Tomas traghetto stop which will take you anywhere quickly if you don't like walking) you are lightyears away from the throngs of people that jam the area around St. Marks and make you think Venice is only an Italian Disneyland, full of souvenir stands and people from back home. Stay here and you will see the real Venice, fall in love with the city and the people and never want to leave. You will be spoiled shamelessly for any other place here and will probably book your next Venice trip months in advance to make sure you can get one of the hotels 6 rooms. Words of warning: if you travel with teenage boys or young men, they WILL fall in love from afar with Rita who lays out breakfast in the garden, and their minds will fill with wild plans to return immediately to Venice if only to gain another glimpse of her and declare their feelings. Also, when you book, the hotel sends you a map of their exact location. Download this and make copies. One comes to Venice partially to get lost and wander, but this hotel is truly a hidden gem and without this map, the getting lost/wandering part could be prolonged. Now please forget everything you just read. Go stay in the Bauer or the Gritti or one of those crazy trendy modernist new places off the Grand Canal. Leave Oltre Il Giardino to those of us who don't want to feel like tourists but beloved guests. This hotel is a tiny dream and selfishly, we don't want to share.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hideaway in a pleasant location”
Reviews.Author: Thonemann
Reviews.Content: Six days in Venice were made perfect by this lovely little hotel. The staff were pleasant, the breakfast in the garden perfect, the room full of character, the wi-fi free (as it should be), the position ideal for arrival by water with heavy bags - a major issue in a city of stepped bridges. Taking a gondola from just round the corner to La Fenice was memorable. Good restaurants are ten minutes away, and five minutes gets you to the vaporetti and the traghetto. Be warned that it is almost literally a "hideaway"; even though the water-taxi had dropped us on the canal-side ten paces from the hotel door, I still had to phone the hotel to find it!

Reviews.Title: “This place made our trip awesome!”
Reviews.Author: rmcleans
Reviews.Content: Even though Venice wasn't our favourite place out of all the places we went to (best was Paris!), this hotel definitely beat all the others! The location is very convenient. You can walk to Roma Piazzale in 5 mins, it's very close to great local restaurants, and quiet at night. We got the junior suite and it was very clean and spacious. (By the way, they provide Bulgari toiletries!) Breakfast was wonderful. On our last morning in Venice, we ate outside in the garden and it's truly relaxing and beautiful. The best thing about this hotel is the staff. Emmanuel and Alessandra are incredibly friendly and they'll go out of their way to help you with anything. Emmanuel definitely knows Venice so don't be afraid to ask him to recommend local restaurants or how to get around the area. We would book with this hotel! No doubt about it.

Reviews.Title: “A Stylish And Welcoming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gingerCanada
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel certainly tries hard to please it's guests and their focus is to ensure you have as wonderful a stay with them as possible. Nothing seems to be too much trouble, and it was a pleasure being treated as valued guests. Too many hotels these days seem to take their guests for granted, but Oltre Il Giardino wants you to return, and it's reflected in their attitude and hospitality. The bedrooms and public areas are all stylishly decorated, and could be featured in any decorating magazine. Details such as fresh flowers in the bedrooms, good quality bath products, and a well stocked bar and afternoon tea or snacks, reflect the attention to detail and the hotels hospitality. Internet connection is also complementary and it is a fresh change from other hotels who charge for this service. The breakfast at the hotel was one of the best I've enjoyed in a long time. Everything was fresh and of good quality, and it was always a delight to come down to a beautifully laid out breakfast. The location is also fabulous, away from the hordes of tourists, and located on a small side canal, in the charming district of San Polo. I would certainly consider this hotel to be one of my favourites and would highly recommend it, it will not disappoint. I really cannot think of anything I would change, and my stay in Venice was made more special by being a guest at this lovely and elegant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Keep this quiet”
Reviews.Author: JaspaGill
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place to stay! I booked on the basis of previous reviews, hoping it would live up to expectations, and it more than met them. Oltre Il Giardino is one of those places which should be a 'best kept secret'. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A peace haven in the San Polo district”
Reviews.Author: theluma
Reviews.Content: Booking a room suitable for our family of 5 is not an easy task and Oltre Il Giardino was a great find! We were offered the 'Ecru Suite' which is located in the hotel annex, literally a couple of steps away from the main building. This suite is brand new (opened a month ago I was told), spacious (approx 80 sq meters) and composed of a living room, a master bedroom (both with a view over a small canal), a second bedroom with 2 single beds (a rollaway bed was placed in the living room for our third kid), ample storage space and 2 smallish but very convenient bathrooms equipped with shower. Other amenities include a mini bar, air conditioning, flat screen TVs in each room, bathrobes and slippers, wonderful Bulgari bath products... We found the Ecru Suite to be spotless clean and very tastefully decorated. Buffet breakfast was included in the rate (plate of ham and cheese, fresh fruit, yogurts, cereal, rolls, pastries and refills of hot drinks) and can be taken in the hotel lobby or in the lovely 'secluded' garden. Every member of staff we met was extremely helpful and friendly. This charming hotel will definitely be our home away from home for our future trips to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Boutique Hotel in the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: firbolg
Reviews.Content: A superb boutique hotel right in the heart of Venice. Located along a quiet side-canal but still only 5mins walk to the Rialto. Beautifully decorated throughout and kept in pristine condition. The staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast is a tasty spread and eating it in the garden is great way to start the day. Well worth paying that little bit extra for.

Reviews.Title: “Really great stay”
Reviews.Author: katekuwait
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Oltre il Giardino for three nights as part of our honeymoon. We were very happy with the hotel, the service was excellent and always friendly, breakfast is included and it was fresh and more substantial than our other Italy hotels, including different hams and cheeses as well as fresh pastries etc. The location is completely perfect, far enough away from the bustle of the Venice hotspots but still an easy, short walk to everywhere. It's really very central on the main islands and everything is close by. It's very quiet and feels more like the 'real' Venice. We slept soundly. Our suite was lovely, simple, clean, separate shower and bath, small clothes closet with safe and mini fridge. If we return to Venice, we'll stay here for sure. Book it now!

Reviews.Title: “Unique Gem”
Reviews.Author: scubajerr
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the junior suite. Wow, this place is gorgeous. The staff was extremely helpful (thank you Emanuele), the room was spotless everyday, breakfast was top of the line, and the garden area is perfect for relaxing after a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “No chintz in sight!”
Reviews.Author: LondonViaggiatore
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed in Venice and this is by far the best place I have stayed in! We stayed in the ground floor suite with the outside terrace. It was a lovely room and there was nothing chintzy about it (something quite hard to achieve in Venice so it seems from past experience). The reason I have rated it a 4 for the room was that the bathroom floor was wet on arrival (looked like a potential spill-over from the shower), there was a slightly tired looking shower curtain and there were a couple of stains on items of furinture. Granted these are not big issues at all and the overall feel of the room was great but perhaps it was not quite up to standard for the price we paid. Other than that our stay was perfect. The breakfast was delicious and the hosts delightful. It was a real oasis from the hustle and bustle of Venice. If i returned to Venice, I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Friendly and Service-Oriented”
Reviews.Author: RomanNoseBoston
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and 2 childrens (ages 12 and 14) for a few nights. The hotel staff was very friendly and very helpful with all aspects of our stay. I don't speak much Italian, but the concierge had a mastery of English. The hotel was the best we stayed in during our European travels...clean and very comfortable. The garden was an oasis from the Venice crowds. The area where the hotel is located is quieter than most neighborhoods, but there were plenty of restaurants within a short walk (less than 10 mins).

Reviews.Title: “A real gem - elegant and eclectic”
Reviews.Author: PreciousPrincess78
Reviews.Content: We chose Oltre Il Giardino after reading a review on Conde Nast Traveller and checking what Trip Advisor had to say about it. All the positives are true. Itâ€™s elegant and eclectic and the service is friendly and relaxed but completely unobtrusive. Thereâ€™s a lovely living room in the house where guests have breakfast in the chillier months and a pretty garden for warmer times. The bedroom we had was a good size with a comfy big bed, TV and charming en suite bathroom. Unlike the rest of Venice they arenâ€™t out to extract as much money out of you as possible at any stage - they were happy to bring us tea and cake in the afternoon and didnâ€™t charge for this or for the numerous waters we had from the mini-bar, even though I prompted them when checking out. The location was fantastic too - it was away from the mass of tourists yet only a few minutes walk away from the vaporetto stop, San Toma, on the Grand Canal. If you do stay at Oltre Il Giardino do go to Trattoria San Toma located on the Campo San Toma. They are super friendly and the place has a lovely relaxed atmosphere where you can settle in for a long lunch or supper with delicious food. Will definitely go back and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Graceful, elegant, peaceful location yet very central and delicious breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: paulnlouise
Reviews.Content: We had an ideal few days in Venice here. The rooms were very comfortable, bed excellent; we were woken to the smell of baking and were presented each morning with a new, and at least to us unknown delicious cake or pastry in addition to freshly squeezed juice and the more familiar array of croissants fresh fruit and cereals. There were those other thoughtful details too - umbrellas for a rainy day, and even a collection of wellies in different sizes for the one afternoon the high tide washed over the canals and inundanted the fundamente. In fact returning to the hotel after this particular day we were greeted with a reviving sweet ginger and peach tea with delicate venetian biscuits. The location is ideal too - 5mins from the vaporetto and literally opposite one of the most important treasures of Venice, the Church and Scuola of the Frari. Our thanks to Lorenzo and his charming and friendly staff for a truly lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “very very nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Giovi31
Reviews.Content: I strongly suggest this nice hotel ! very cozy atmosphere, the rooms are very nicely decorated (finally one hotel with no venetian decoration! it was very hard to find...) and most of all the service is really unforgettable, from the moldavian girl at breakfast and her smile to the guys at the reception! They all were very friendly and truly interested in their guest! We (guests) were few at that time and in any case the rooms are only six so the place is never crowded and this helps to make you feel just like home. We took the blue room on the second floor and it was very nice and spacious with bedroom and living room separated. We also staied in the room next door which is smaller but still spacious and nicely decorated. A nice memory I have is that perfect mix of espresso,fresh bread and croissant that I could smell every morning going down the stairs... what a wonderful way to start your day. ps: two steps from the hotel you will find the MURO Restaurant. It is not the classic trattoria in fact is vey modern but I guarantee the food was very very good. After 8 hours of walking and 8 degrees under zero, it was nice to have a good restaurant close to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Oasis”
Reviews.Author: LollySue
Reviews.Content: I read a review in Travel & Leisure about this hotel and was not disappointed. If you prefer to stay away from the crowds, enjoy personalized service, excellent food (breakfast) and attentive service then this small hotel is the ideal place to stay. We stayed in the Green room, it was like a suite. The rooms were clean and large (bedroom, sitting room) and we had our own private outdoor seating area. An ideal place to stay while visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly serene hotel in la Serenissima”
Reviews.Author: NannarellaBoston
Reviews.Content: Oltre il Giardino is a beautiful old house that sits on a quiet canal (Rio di San Stin) in a charming residential/historical neighborhood in San Polo. The house itself and the room we stayed in (Ivory) are decorated in a simple, sophisticated style. Clean decor and very comfy bed. Spotless bath and a large walk-in closet. Service here, as mentioned in other reviews, is warm and friendly. Rita's breakfast service is charming and efficient, but not intrusive (the food's excellent--many choices, and all of it of high quality). Tommaso and Emmanuele on the night desk patiently plotted directions and helped us plan walks and excursions in the city and to the outer islands. And during our stay, we learned that Lorenzo (the owner) took care to find a doctor (friend of the family) who was able to replace the prescription medications a guest had forgotten to pack. This help is offered in the friendliest, easiest way imaginable. The hospitality offered here is of a very high order indeed. We stayed four nights and were sorry it wasn't longer. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: smk007
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel and would return without hesitation. There are only 6 rooms in a converted house entered through a small walled garden beside a canal - you get a key for your room and the garden door. Breakfast is in the garden when warm enough - there is a buffet of cereals, yoghurt, various cakes and pastries; coffee, cheese and hams are brought to the table separately. We had the turquoise room, a small suite with a large bathroom. This was very comfortable and I would recommend it. Pictures are attached to this review. The bathroom is supplied with Bulgari soaps etc. The shower gel was only replenished once during a 4 night stay though. The bed and pillows were on the hard side - I found this fine but it may be an issue if you like a big marshmallow bed. There was free internet access in the room via ethernet cable (we brought our own) - wireless access was not available. There was also A/C. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The main public room was a nice quiet place to take shelter during hotter parts of the day and has bookshelves sticked with books on Venice and guidebooks left by past guests. There is also a small table of bottles here. The location of the hotel is ideal, a few seconds form the Frari and very quiet. The best hot chocolate in Venice is about 10 minutes away in Vizio Virtu and the Trattoria San Toma is a great lunch spot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: HEATWAVER
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading the reviews on TA and we were not disappointed. It is in the centre of Venice away from the most touristy areas but within easy reach of anything you need to see either on foot or on the vaporetto which stops nearby. I cannot recommend the Oltre il Giardino too highly. It is a haven of peace in a very busy city. We went in August when the place was hot and coming back across the little bridge and going through the gate into the hotel gardens was like passing from one world into another. Our room was spacious, spotless and cool. Breakfasting outside in the garden under the awnings was just perfect. However possibly the best thing about this hotel is the staff who are all friendly and attentive to ones every need. I will definitely return there if we get to Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: faye92
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the airport on a delayed flight from Sicily at midnight and found that there were no water taxis waiting and so caught the ferry and vaporetto to San toma. It was quite a stressful journey as my plan was to step into a water taxi and step off at the hotel door we had no clue as to which direction we needed to go. The lovely guy at the hotel guided us there and waited for. He let us in and took our suitcases upto the top floor. The hotel is lovely. Our room was very nice and the staff are very helpful. One was very apologetic about being so enthusiastic about venice which was so refreshing. He obviously loved his city and we thought he was a really great guy. The location of the hotel is great - a 5 minute walk from San Toma vaporetti stop and close to a couple of squares with nice restaurants. Also, close to Frari Church which is amazing inside. The breakfasts at the hotel were very good. If you want an elegant, personal hotel away from the very touristy areas then you can't go wrong with Oltre il Giardino. We will most likely visit Venice again but when it's cooler - it was a bit hot in August to walk around all day. We shall go back to this hotel - it is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, delightul staff, elegant rooms, an oasis in bustling Venice.”
Reviews.Author: c3ath
Reviews.Content: We had very high expectations of Oltre Il Giardino, having read the positive reviews left by others, and we weren't disappointed. We had a junior suite (the 'blue room') on the top floor and throughly enjoyed the space and the delightful view over the garden. The staff could not have been more helpful and the breakfasts, served outside under a canopy, were delightful. I enjoyed the real silver cutlery and the superb linens and it was a pleasure to have a quiet drink at the end of the day in the relaxing living room. I particularly enjoyed crossing the small bridge over the canal and slipping through the private garden door of the hotel - it really felt like living in Venice rather than staying at a hotel. The location is great - quiet, but within easy walking distance of all the major sites. We found a couple of good restaurants nearby and the hotel staff gave us some very helpful recommendations. A couple of tiny drawbacks. Our room only had a shower and not a bath. The air-conditioning unit in our room was noisy and I made the silly mistake of turning it off and opening the windows instead, resulting in a few annoying mosquito bites. I also found the bed rather hard, although this does seem to be a general Italian preference, rather than a feature of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Mr&MrsWilko
Reviews.Content: A brilliant place to stay. This was our third trip to Venice but our first staying at Oltre Il Giardino and we would now not stay anywhere else in the future. Great room, with a lovely bathroom. Breakfast in the garden was a real treat and the choice and quality of food was excellent. All the staff were incredibly helpful - they organised restaurant reservations (at some fabulous restaurants); let us use the hotel's computer to complete on-line check in for our return flights; carried luggage a couple of streets to the water taxi collection point, etc. Very much looking forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Garden of earthly delights”
Reviews.Author: YetiBear
Reviews.Content: Everything you could ever want in the heart of Venice. Very kind staff, a lovely room, and a fine breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Essence of Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Elph
Reviews.Content: Located on a quiet canal, near Frari, you will find an inconspicuous door, behind which lies a secret walled garden. This three-storey family-run hotel has only six rooms. They provide cheerful personalized hospitality service. The water taxi can take you directly to the front door of the hotel, or this is an easy five-minute walk from the San Toma vaporetto stop. Although we arrived close to midnight, we were very warmly welcomed. The hotel staff is very friendly, fluent in English and enthusiastically suggest the best ways to experience Venice (which is, by the way, at dawn). They have a long list of their personally recommended restaurants, from which they can help you choose exactly what suits your tastes. They said they donâ€™t recommend â€œtourist restaurantsâ€�. We stayed in the Grey Suite, which is spacious, tastefully furnished and bright, with three windows overlooking the garden and the canal. The bathroom is huge and very well equipped. As a nice welcoming touch, Venetian chocolate awaits at each side of the bed. Breakfast, depending on the weather, is served either in the ground floor room or outside, in the garden under a canopy. This special hotel offers their guests a wide selection of guide books and even a loan of sunhats. To illustrate our experience, when we arrived back at the hotel late one evening, and lingered in the garden for a moment, the staff, without a word being spoken, set out candles. Never have I been more pleased by my choice of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A gem - higly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Curley44
Reviews.Content: There are many places to stay in Venice from opulent 5 star hotels decked out in traditional Venetian to weird B&Bâ€™s. Oltre Il Giardino is thankfully none of these and is more akin to your own little villa. We felt at home the moment we stepped through the door. Itâ€™s small, which is what we like, with only a handful of rooms, but so personable. The team are friendly and helpful but not intrusive and are happy to let you come and go as you wish (but always with a friendly â€œbuon giornoâ€� or â€œbuona notteâ€�). Equally they will advise you on where to visit or eat if you want. We were celebrating our second wedding anniversary and had opted for a suite, which frankly was the same price as an average room in one of the larger hotels. We had the suite on the ground floor and although we were worried it might be noisy (you could sometimes hear people in the reception when sat in the lounge area of the suite), once you closed the large wooden doors to the bedroom there was silence. It was beautifully decorated in an old-and-new combination with a discreet LCD TV perched on a beautiful antique desk, a comfy modern sofa set next to a vintage wardrobe, 18th Century paintings and fresh flowers. The bathroom was definitely not vintage and you had a plentiful of nice towels and toiletries. There was a mini bar but, you could also order drinks from reception which were brought on a tray with delicious nibbles. For breakfast there was fresh fruit, cereals, yoghurts and the most delicious pastries and croissants. There was also cheese and meats available. Weather permitting you can take breakfast outside in the garden which is lovely. The location was spot on, in the centre of Venice, a stoneâ€™s throw from the Grand Canal and the major sights but, without the throngs of tourists that you find elsewhere. We felt as though we were staying where the locals hung out rather than in a major tourist area and walking back at night along the small canal was beautiful and so romantic. The Santa Maria dei Frari Church, which is just over the small canal, is definitely worth a visit. Close by is the CaffÃ© Dei Frari, which is a place where the locals pop in after work for a glass of Prosecco and a tasty sandwich, and you really should join them. Also close by and worth going to is Birraria la Corte, which is a large pizzeria / restaurant that serves great food and again is a favourite of the locals. In Venice the best thing to do is go for a long walk and just get lost, although thatâ€™s difficult since there are signs pointing to the Rialto and San Marco on every corner. You will stumble across some lovely squares, quirky shops and wonderful places to eat. Visit the Peggy Guggenheim Museum, which has some good modern art but, is also in a great location on the Grand Canal. For great views over the whole of Venice take a vaporetto from San Marco to San Giorgio and go up to the top of the bell tower of San Giorgio Maggiore â€“ fantastic. As you can probably tell, we had a great time in Venice, despite the rain, and this was certainly aided by staying at the wonderful Oltre Il Giardino. A gem of a place, which we would certainly go back to and definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic”
Reviews.Author: LondonMarkC
Reviews.Content: What a perfect hideaway in Venice. We absolutely loved the hotel. There are only 8 rooms and the place feels so welcoming. We had a suite on the ground floor which overlooked the garden. The staff were simply fantastic, they were so helpful and always went out of their way to help. It rained the entire time we were in Venice but the fact we enjoyed ourselves so much was in large part due to the hotel. A real gem, I will be recommending the hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful B&B!”
Reviews.Author: PnaiJen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this B&B in Sept 2007. We immediately loved the hotel as soon as we entered the front gate. You go through their garden and walk into the beautiful first level, where they have are couches and books (including area guide books) that you can borrow during your stay. We stayed in the grey room on the top floor. It was a very romantic room, and a nice bathroom with Bulgari amenities. In the mornings, they serve breakfast outside in the garden. In terms of location, as soon as you go out of the front gate, it is right next to a small canal, and it is about a 5-10 min walk to the grand canal and the closest vaporetto (water bus) stop. The location was really great - about 10 min walk to Rialto and 10-15 min walk to the train and bus stations. The hotel is a stone's throw away from the Frari, which I probably would not have thought of visiting hadn't it been so close, but I would definitely recommend it for those who like art. Also, make sure to try the hazelnut gelato at Gelateria Millevoglie behind the Frari.. delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, lovely people”
Reviews.Author: Minty_Danni
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here earlier this month and we very much enjoyed our stay. Venice was 30+ degrees and sunny, so it was nice to have air conditioning and a portable fridge (i.e. very small) with cold water in it. The staff were very polite, friendly, and helpful across the board. They made some good recommendations of places to eat dinner and we enjoyed talking to them (they each spoke excellent English and, of course, Italian). Breakfast was gorgeous--we ate outside every morning. There was a very good selection of foods on offer and a healthy choice: muesli, fresh fruit, dried fruit, cakes, croissants, buns, and a plate of ham and cheese if you wish it. I love the serpentine-shaped biscuits they had. Well situated--not far from the Rialto bridge and close to plenty of nice places selling Murano glass. Gardens are hard to come by in Venice--this one is lovely and a truly fabulous hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “A truly delightful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SonjaWinston
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter, and I just returned home after spending five nights at Oltre il Giardino. We are already planning a return visit for early next year. Oltre il Giardino is located on a small canal behind the Santa Maria Gloriosa dei Frari church, in a quiet location not overwhelmed by large groups of tourists but close to excellent restaurants and a short walk to the traghetto and the Rialto Bridge. (Better yet, because it is so close to the Frari, one of Veniceâ€™s major churches, you never have to worry about not being able to find your way back!) Oltre il Giardino's owners and staff are extremely helpful and friendly, knowledgeable about Venice, and eager to help with suggestions and restaurant reservations. They are also gracious and thoughtful hosts. The building is beautifully renovated and maintained; the rooms are comfortable, luxurious, and large. When the weather is good, be sure to have breakfast in the garden, where you can eat delicious pastries and fruit and sip wonderful cappuccino while listening to the birds and the Frari bells. If you want to learn more about the art and history of Venice, I suggest you engage Howard Fitzpatrick, an American art historian who lives in Venice, for a private walking tour early during your stay at Oltre il Giardino. Heâ€™ll take you to well-known places, as well as to places most tourists never see, while describing the art, architecture, and history of Venice. Our time with Howard was one of the high points of our visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at Oltre Il Giardino!!”
Reviews.Author: MYS79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Oltre Il Giardino for five nights in May, 2008, as we were in Venice for part of our honeymoon. We absolutely LOVED everything about this hotel -- I don't even feel it's accurate to call it a "hotel" - it's more like staying at a Venetian's home -- a really NICE, beautiful, private home. We stayed in the Green Suite, which is located on the bottom floor of Oltre Il Giardino - at first, we were concerned about noise of others coming in and going out of the property, but we didn't hear anything - except church bells and children playing at a school from nearby. As there are so few people staying at the hotel, and our suite was so spacious (with beautiful antique wooden doors separating the bedroom area from the sitting room), we slept incredibly well. We actually loved the extra privacy of being on the 1st floor by ourselves, and the Green Suite had its own private patio, which we enjoyed on the sunny days/evenings with a bottle of Italian wine. The Green Suite, I believe, is one of the most spacious of the rooms at Oltre Il Giardino - if you stay there, we highly recommend this room. It's a LOT of space for a european hotel - our hotel room in paris was about the size of the BATHROOM in our room at Oltre Il Giardino! It was all of the little touches which were really amazing about this place. On several evenings, we came back to find lit candles on the patio table, which was a really nice surprise. When we were out one evening, my husband had bought me two roses from a street vendor (a little touristy, yes, but we figured why not since it was our honeymoon!). That night, we put them in a vase in our room which held other flowers. When we came back to our room the following afternoon (after the room had been made up), we found the roses in their own separate vase. Little touches like this were unexpected, but really made this a very special place. On our last night at the hotel, we were chatting with the lovely gentleman (Manuele) who had the night shift. We were trading email addresses, and he also handed to us a long, detailed recipe of how to make homemade pizza (we had been speaking with him the night before about the differences between NYC and Italian pizza). It was the sweetest gesture, and indicative of how special a place Oltre Il Giardino really was. If you love boutique hotels, this is definitely the place for you. This isn't the Gritti Palace or the Bauer Hotel, but that's what we loved about it. Note - children are allowed to stay at the property, and there were families there during our visit, but the only times we ever saw anyone else was at breakfast (which was simple but very tasty - the pastries are fantastic). We highly recommend Oltre Il Giardino for anyone looking for a romantic and quiet get-away.

Reviews.Title: “calm, cosy and stylish with great staff”
Reviews.Author: foofoo28
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at this property after scouring the reviews. my main motivation was the way it looked (and the positive reviews) and its location. the hotel we stayed in the grey room which was very calm and comfortable. the style was simple but elegant with a small mini fridge for convieniece. there was also a tv, which we never turned on and the facility to control the air conditioning. we overlooked the garden, as do all the rooms, and looked out on to residential buildings, which were typically italian style. you could also see the canal, with its very occasional traffic. we had lovely weather and sat out in the garden for breakfast which was lovely. the only reason i havn't rated this prpoerty excellent is that the garden while not at all unkept, could have done with the lawn maintained and cut. maybe i felt this beacuse my husband keeps our garden looking pretty good and is always in it- i think he secretly wanted to mow their lawn! breakfast was functional with the usual cereal, yogurts and croissants and pastrys - no hot food but we knew this beforehand and enjoyed what we had. the staff all the staff were fantastic -friendly and helpful. we asked for dinner recommendations and elanor gave us several, also with a very helpful map. we got in late one night and emanuelle made us feel so at home. the other gentleman on reception also booked us a water taxi back to the airport. location we specifically wanted to stay away from the touristy areas and we were so glad we did. the area in which the hotel was located was just a few minutes away from the canalside through a mainly residential area. it was so quiet and relaxed and we feel we would have really missed out if we had stayed nearer the main attractions. we explored alot on foot and came across may lovely streets and sqaures. we wouldnt hesitate to stay here again although some might find it too quiet - it was just perfect for us as we wanted a relaxing, friendly environment.

Reviews.Title: “As long as it's the best”
Reviews.Author: Trendyacademic
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Venice and did a lot of research on where to stay. I wanted somewhere central, but quiet, and I was prepared to pay a fair bit to get somewhere special. Oltre Il Giardino won hands down, and the reality turned out to match the dream. The standard of service was exceptional, but friendly and welcoming. I was a solo traveller, pretty rare for Venetian accommodation, and they sussed that I wanted to be left to myself for a quiet break. They also gave me 10% off the final bill even though I was occupying one of their junior suites at double-room rates. The view from my room was unparalleled. I slept with the curtains on the far window open so I was woken by the sunlight and the view, and I often put down the fly screen and opened the window just to hear the birds and the bells. Yet when the windows were closed and the curtains shut, no sound or light would disturb you. The bathroom was flawless, the breakfast was amazing - not just the traditional ham, cheese and bread, but first-rate coffee and a wide selection of cereals, fresh fruits, and Venetian pastries. And the garden - wow - the star jasmine was out in all its glory, giving a gentle fragrance to everything. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. It's not cheap, but it's worth every euro for a magnificent experience. I will be back on my next trip to Europe without a doubt.

HotelInfo.Name: Oltre Il Giardino
HotelInfo.Address: San Polo 2542 | Fondamenta Contarini, 30125 Venice, Italy
